# Goals
- Load a simple dataset (e.g., CPI), create a train/test split.
- Fit a baseline OLS, compute MAE/MSE/R².

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
set.seed(42)
n <- 200
df <- tibble(feature = rnorm(n))
df <- df |> mutate(y = 2*feature + rnorm(n, sd = 0.5))

idx <- sample(1:n, size = floor(0.75*n))
train <- df[idx, ]
test  <- df[-idx, ]

fit <- lm(y ~ feature, data = train)
pred <- predict(fit, newdata = test)

MAE <- mean(abs(test$y - pred))
MSE <- mean((test$y - pred)^2)
R2  <- cor(test$y, pred)^2

cat("MAE:", round(MAE,3), "\nMSE:", round(MSE,3), "\nR^2:", round(R2,3), "\n")
```
